data.title: Sweden
data.meta_description: Gustaf VI Adolf, born 11 Nov., 1882, succeeded on the death of his father, King Gustaf V, 29 Oct., 1950. Married: (1) 15 June, 1905, to Princess Margaret Victoria, born 15 Jan., 1882, died 1 May, 1920, daughter of Prince Arthur, Duke of Connaught: (2) 3 Nov., 1923,...
data.text:
Statistical Information.—The Central Bureau of Statistics (Kungl. Statistiska Centralbyrån, Stockholm 2) was founded in 1858, in succession to the Kungl. Tabellkom-ruissionen which had been set up in 1756; Director-General.—(Mrs.) Dr. Karin Kock. The main statistical publications include: —

Statistisk årsbok för Sverige (Annuaire statistique de la Suède). (First year, 1914.)

Bidrag till Sveriges officiella Statistik. 1857–1920.

Sveriges officiella Statistik. From 1911. (With summaries in French, from 1952 in English).

Årsbok för Sveriges komrauner. First issue, 1918. (For distribution, as a rule, only within Scandinavia.)

Statistisk tidskrift (Statistical Review). 1862–1913, and from 1952.

Statistiska meddelanden. From 1912. Including: Occasional Statistical Investigations (a), not yet arranged for (b) Monthly Trade Statistics (c). Railway Statistical Returns (d), Banking Returns (e) Social Returns (f)

The Swedish Economic Review. Compiled by the Swedish Board of Trade. Published by the Swedish Foreign Office. Issued quarterly. 1922–40.

Lönestatistisk Årsbok [Salaries and wages; with summary in French or English]. Published by the Social Board. From 1929.

Meddelanden från Konjunkturinstitutet. Series A (from 1938) and B (from 1939); both with summaries in English. Stockholm.

Sveriges riksbank. Published by the Bank of Sweden. Annual. Stockholm, from 1908.

The Swedish national debt office. Report. Annual. (First issue 1920.) Stockholm.

Biksräkenskapsverkets Årsbok [State finances]. Annual. Stockholm, from 1929–30.

Sveriges statskalender. Published by Vetenskapsakademien. Annual. Uppsala.

Social Work and Legislation in Sweden. Survey published by order of the Swedish Government. Stockholm, 1938. (New edition in preparation.)

Svensk industrikalender. Swedish Industrial directory. Published by the Federation of Swedish Industries. Stockholm. Annual.

Svensk exportkalender. Swedish export directory. Published by the General Export Association of Sweden. Stockholm. Annual, from 1917.

Norrland. Natur, befolkning och nǎringar. Published by the Geographical Society of Stockholm and the Institute of Industrial Research. Stockholm, 1942.

The Postwar Programme of Swedish Labour. Stockholm, 1944; English edition, 1946.

The Outlook in Sweden. Long-term economic surrey, 1951–55. Stockholm, 1952.

Afzelius (N.), Books in English on Sweden. 3rd ed. Stockholm, 1951.

Ahlmann (H. W.) and others, Sverige Nu: Atlas över Folk, Land och Näringar. Stockholm, 1949.

Akerman (A.) and others, Swedish contributions to the development of plant breeding. Stockholm, 1938.

Andersson (I.), L’Histoire de la Suède. Stockholm, 1951.

Anderson (I.) and others, Introduction to Sweden. 2nd ed. Stockholm, 1951.

Andersson (S.) and Starland (H.), Problèmes et Législation du Travail en Suède. Stockholm, 1952.

Arvidson (S.), Education Suédoise. Stockholm, 1951.

Childs (M. W.), Sweden: The Middle Way. 3rd ed. Chicago, 1948.—This is Democracy. New Haven. 1938.

Düring (I.), The Swedish School-Reform 1950. Uppsala, 1951.

Eldh (A.) (editor), Facts About Sweden. Stockholm, 1951.

Elshult (A.), Höök (E.) and Risberg (H.), La Vie économique de la Suède. Stockholm, 1952.

Forster (P. Margaret), School for Life: A Study of the People’s Colleges in Sweden. London, 19–14.

Fraser (M.), In Praise of Sweden. London, 1947.

Furuskog (J.), Vårt land. Stockholm. 1943.

Gullander (A.), Farmers’ Co-operation in Sweden. London, 1949.

Hallendorff (C.) and Schück (A.), History of Sweden. Stockholm and London, 1938.

Heckscher (G.), Pluralist Democracy, the Swedish Experience. Stockholm, 1949.

Heinig (K.), Der schwedische Mittelweg—Soziale Sicherheit. 2nd ed. Hamburg, 1949.

Herlitz (Nils), Sweden: A Modern Democracy on Ancient Foundations. Minneapolis. 1939.

Heywood (T.), Background to Sweden. London, 1951.

Hilker (F.), Die Schwedische Schulreform. Wiesbaden, 1949.

Hornborg (E.), Sveriges Historia, Stockholm, 1940.

Höijer (E.), Sveriges jordbruk. 3rd ed. Stockholm, 1946.

Lamming (N.), Sweden’s Co-operative Enterprise. Manchester, 1940.

Leger (C.), La Démocratie Industrielle et les Comités d’Entreprise en Suède. Paris, 1950.

Marcus (M.), The Liquor Control System in Sweden. Stockholm, 1946.

Maury (L.), Métamorphose de la Suède. Paris, 1951.

Montgomery (A.), How Sweden overcame the depression, 1930–1933. Stockholm, 1938.— The Rise of Modern Industry in Sweden. London. 1939.

Myrdal (Alva), Nation and Family. New York and London. 1941.

Nobel, The Man and His Prizes. Published by the Nobel Foundation. Stockholm, 1950.

Norgren (Paul H.), The Swedish Collective Bargaining System. Cambridge (Mass.), 1941.

Odhe (T.), Consumer Co-operation in Sweden’s Economic Life. Stockholm, 1949.

Queffélec (H.), Portrait de la Suède. Paris, 1948.

Hickman (A. F.), Swedish Iron Ore. London. 1939.

Robbins (J. J,), The Government and Labor Relations in Sweden. Chapel Hill, N.O. 1942.

Roberts (N. S.), Economic and Commercial Conditions in Sweden, April, 1950. H.M.S.O., 1950.

Scandinavian Co-operation. A Report to the Council of Europe prepared by the delegates from Denmark, Iceland, Norway, and Sweden to the Consultative Assembly of the Council. Stockholm, 1951.

Schmidt (F.), Einfü in das schwedische Rechtsleben. Lund, 1950.

Sellin (T.), Recent Penal Legislation in Sweden. Stockholm, 1947.

Sjögren (O.), Sverige: geografisk beskrivning. Parts 1–5. Stockholm, 1929–35.

Streyffert (Th.), The Forests of Sweden. Stockholm, 1938.

Suède Forestière (Annales de l’Ecole Nationale des Eaux et Forêts). Nancy, 1949.

Sranstr#x00F6;m (R.) and Palmstierna (C), Histoire de Suède. Paris, 1947.

Tegner (G.), La Sécurité Sociale eu Suède. Stockholm, 1951.

Tennant (P. F. D.), The Scandinavian Book. London, 1951.

The Northern Countries. Published by the foreign ministries of Denmark, Finland, Iceland, Norway and Sweden. Stockholm, 1951.

Thomas (Dorothy S.), Social and Economic Aspects of Swedish Population Movements. 1760–1933. New York, 1941.

Tingsten (H.), The Debate on the Foreign Policy of Sweden 1918–1939. Oxford University Press. Oxford, New York, and Toronto, 1949.

Turi (J.), Book of Lappland. (English translation by E. Gee Nash.) London, 1931.
